intro: Actinostemma racemosum, commonly known as the racemose actinostemma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Actinostemma racemosum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
